title: Chris Hemsworth becomes Australia's god of tourism
text:
So, who sells Australia best?

To launch its new $38 million international tourism campaign in Sydney on Wednesday, Tourism Australia flew in London-based author Kathy Lette; wildlife warrior Terry Irwin from Australia Zoo in Queensland; headline local chef Kylie Kwong – and Tourism Australia's biggest gun, actor Chris Hemsworth, who arrived fresh off an early morning flight out of Byron Bay, where his controversial $20 million mega-mansion is nearing completion.

During the hour-long launch at the Sydney Opera House, absent but key Australian personalities to score mentions included Paul Hogan, Kylie Minogue – and even Atlassian co-founder Mike Cannon-Brookes – all of whom are tipped to play a role in Tourism Australia's latest campaign, which will run through until 2022.

What's your philausophy on that? Actor Chris Hemsworth flew into Sydney from Byron Bay to launch Tourism Australia's new $38 million marketing campaign. Getty

Best known for playing Thor (and being voted the "Sexiest Man Alive" by People magazine in 2014), Hemsworth, 36, signed on as Tourism Australia's global ambassador in 2016 and is considered one of the nation's greatest assets when it comes to promoting inbound tourism.

If Hemsworth was a big hit before the throng of media, the new campaign's slogan – "Come Live our Philausophy", devised by M &C Saatchi – has met with mixed reactions.
description: Regardless of your philosophy on misspellings, it's hard not to like a new tourism campaign led by actor Chris Hemsworth.
